articles.title: Floral Basket to Kim Jong Un from Japanese Delegation
articles.content:
Floral Basket to Kim Jong Un from Japanese Delegation
Pyongyang, February 13 (KCNA) -- Supreme leader Kim Jong Un was presented with a floral basket by the visiting delegation of the Japanese Society for the Study of the Juche Idea on the occasion of the birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il.
					 The floral basket was handed to an official concerned on Thursday by Yukie Ikebe, co-representative of the Kansai Liaison Council for the Study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism.

articles.title: Delegation of General Association of Koreans in China Here
articles.content:
Delegation of General Association of Koreans in China Here
Pyongyang, February 13 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the General Association of Koreans in China headed by Chairwoman Choe Un Bok arrived here Thursday to celebrate the birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: Japanese Delegation Here
articles.content:
Japanese Delegation Here
Pyongyang, February 13 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the Japanese Society for the Study of the Juche Idea headed by Yukie Ikebe, co-representative of the Kansai Liaison Council for the Study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism, arrived here on Thursday to observe the birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: Foreign Figure-Skaters Here
articles.content:
Foreign Figure-Skaters Here
Pyongyang, February 13 (KCNA) -- Figure-skaters of Russia, Latvia, Belarus, Italy, the Czech Republic and Serbia arrived here Thursday to take part in the 23rd Paektusan Prize International Figure Skating Festival to be held to mark the birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il (Day of the Shining Star).

articles.title: Floral Tribute Paid to Statues of Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Floral Tribute Paid to Statues of Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
Pyongyang, February 13 (KCNA) -- Foreigners visited the statues of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il on Mansu Hill on Thursday on the occasion of the birth anniversary of Kim Jong Il.
					 They were a delegation of the Japanese Society for the Study of the Juche Idea and staff members of missions of the UNDP, WHO, UNICEF, UNFP and UNFAO here.
					
					 They laid floral baskets before the statues and paid tribute to them in humblest reverence for the peerlessly great men.

articles.title: Foreign Embassy Officials Visit National Pencil Drawing Festival
articles.content:
Foreign Embassy Officials Visit National Pencil Drawing Festival
Pyongyang, February 13 (KCNA) -- Foreign embassy officials for cultural and friendship relations here on Thursday visited the venue of the 5th National Pencil Drawing Festival for celebrating the birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il (Day of the Shining Star).
					 They looked round pencil drawings of various themes including those showing the exploits of Kim Jong Il, who defended the socialist motherland and laid the eternal foundation for prosperity under the unfurled banner of Songun and the DPRK service personnel and people working hard under the leadership of Marshal Kim Jong Un.
					
					 At the end of the visit the guests made entries in the visitor's book.
					
					 They also enjoyed a concert of the National Symphony Orchestra at the Moranbong Theatre on the same day.

articles.title: Anniversary of Torch for Bringing About Radical Turn in Editorial Writing Marked
articles.content:
Anniversary of Torch for Bringing About Radical Turn in Editorial Writing Marked
Pyongyang, February 13 (KCNA) -- There took place on Wednesday a meeting marking the 40th anniversary of the torch lit by leader Kim Jong Il to bring about a radical turn in writing editorials.
					 Present there were Kim Ki Nam, secretary of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, officials in the field of media, journalists, editors and employees of Rodong Sinmun and persons of merit.
					
					 Ri Yong Sik, editor-in-chief of Rodong Sinmun, made a report.
					
					 The reporter said: Kim Jong Il brought about a radical turn in editorial writing in the party paper 40 years ago, a historic event which helped dynamically advance the cause of modeling whole society on Kimilsungism by effecting a great change in the party's ideological work.
					
					 Under his leadership Rodong Sinmun has dramatically changed its appearance as the paper of the leader, the ideological vanguard of the Songun revolution.
					
					 He meticulously guided all the issues related to writing editorials and thereby made the flames of the editorial revolution, paper revolution unprecedented in history rage furiously in the party paper and brought about a fundamental turn in the work of the party media.
					
					 During the arduous march, the forced march when the Korean revolution was facing grim ordeals, he tightly held a writing brush along with arms of Songun and directed big efforts to enhancing the function of the party paper. 
					
					 Under his energetic guidance the political and ideological power of the party paper was augmented in every way and Rodong Sinmun could powerfully inspire the cause of the Songun revolution, the cause of building a thriving nation in the van of the ideological front of the party. 
					
					 His idea of attaching importance to writing brush and his leadership are being given steady continuity by supreme leader Kim Jong Un.
					
					 The wise guidance of Kim Jong Un, who is successfully carrying forward the undying revolutionary feats of Kim Jong Il, is becoming a basic source to help the party paper make a new revolution in editorial writing and bring about a revolutionary turn in editing and publishing the party paper.
					
					 The reporter called upon all journalists, editors and employees of the party paper to give steady continuity to the proud history and tradition of the revolution in editorial writing in the 1970s in the present general advance to usher in the prosperity of Songun Korea and thus successfully discharge the honorable mission and duties they assumed before the party and revolution.

articles.title: Active Leading Personnel of WPRG Visit War Museum
articles.content:
Active Leading Personnel of WPRG Visit War Museum
Pyongyang, February 13 (KCNA) -- The participants in the meeting of active leading personnel of the Worker-Peasant Red Guards (WPRG) visited the Victorious Fatherland Liberation War Museum.
					 They paid tribute to the statue of President Kim Il Sung waving back to cheering people at the square where the military parade was held to celebrate the war victory.
					
					 They laid bouquets before the sculpture "Victory" in the Monument to the Victorious Fatherland Liberation War and paid homage to the victors of great age.
					
					 They went round various halls of the museum wonderfully arranged as a monument of the era conveying the exploits Kim Il Sung performed in winning the victory in the war and the Songun revolutionary exploits performed by leader Kim Jong Il, a centre of education in the tradition of the victory in the war and a main base of anti-U.S. and class education.
					
					 They also visited the Museum of Weapons and Equipment of the Korean People's Army.
					
					 Being briefed on the fact that the museum was successfully built thanks to the infinite loyalty and moral obligation of supreme leader Kim Jong Un, who is glorifying the exploits the great men of Mt. Paektu performed by strengthening the Juche-oriented national defence industry and its revolutionary armed forces, they went round various halls and outdoor exhibition ground.

articles.title: People Swear Loyalty to Kim Jong Un at Kim Jong Il's Birthplace
articles.content:
People Swear Loyalty to Kim Jong Un at Kim Jong Il's Birthplace
Samjiyon, February 12 (KCNA) -- A large crowd of people met at leader Kim Jong Il's birthplace in the secret camp in Mt. Paektu, the temple of the sun, Wednesday to vow to hold him in high esteem for all ages and remain loyal to the Songun revolutionary leadership of Marshal Kim Jong Un on the occasion of Kim Jong Il's birth anniversary (Day of the Shining Star).
					 Present at the event were Jang Jong Nam, Choe Thae Bok, Kwak Pom Gi, officials of party and armed forces organs and working people's organizations, ministries, national institutions, persons of merit, service personnel of the Korean People's Army and the Korean People's Internal Security Forces and officials and people in Ryanggang Province.
					
					 Speeches were made there.
					
					 Choe Hwi, first vice department director of the C.C., the Workers' Party of Korea, referred to the facts that Kim Jong Il developed the WPK into a guiding force for the Songun revolution, converted the country into a politico-ideological power based on the single-minded unity and an invincible military power and laid a firm foundation for realizing all dreams and ideals of the people on this land.
					
					 He expressed the firm determination to strengthen the unity and cohesion of the party in every way and dynamically push forward the work for firmly preparing all members of society as Kimilsungists-Kimjongilists this year.
					
					 Kang Pyo Yong, vice-minister of the People's Armed Forces, recalled that Kim Jong Il built the People's Army into a strong army of a harmonious whole and into a-match-for-a-hundred revolutionary armed forces, thus providing a powerful politico-military foundation for the prosperity of the great Paektusan nation.
					
					 He expressed the will of all servicepersons to become the first-line lifeguards and death-defying corps of Kim Jong Un protecting the Central Committee of the Party headed by him and the Kumsusan Palace of the Sun.
					
					 Vice-Premier Jon Sung Hun expressed the determination to thoroughly establish the monolithic leadership system of the Party in state economic work, unconditionally carry out the idea and line of Kim Jong Un and the economic policies of the party and make a fresh leap forward in every worksite of the country for a great surge.
					
					 Fireworks were displayed in the sky above the secret camp.
					
					 The rally powerfully demonstrated the unshakable will of all service personnel and people to glorify Kim Jong Il's idea and cause forever and exalt the dignity and national power of the great Paektusan nation, united close behind Kim Jong Un.

articles.title: Women's Union Art Performance Marks Kim Jong Il's Birth Anniversary
articles.content:
Women's Union Art Performance Marks Kim Jong Il's Birth Anniversary
Pyongyang, February 13 (KCNA) -- Officials of women's union and its members gave an art performance in the Hall of Women on Thursday on the occasion of the birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il.
					 Put on the stage were a paean to him and chorus "Let's Sing of Our February Holiday."
					
					 In a dialogic poem "Forest of Mt. Paektu Sways", the performers sang high praises of the personality of Kim Jong Il as a great man, who devoted himself to the happiness of people, visiting the area of Mt. Paektu even on his birthday, the day when he should receive best wishes from all the people.
					
					 Pak Song Sil, worker at the General Restaurant of Kaeson Youth Park, recalled that Kim Jong Il visited the park in December, Juche 100 (2011) despite very cold weather and showed warm benevolence for those who serve the people there.
					
					 Also staged were choruses "Song of Love for People" and "The General Will Live Forever as the Sun" reflecting the will of the Korean people including all Korean women to hold Kim Jong Il in high esteem for all ages.
					
					 Jong Ok Yong, guide at Munsu Water Park, told the story about how the color plaster statue of Kim Jong Il was erected in the lobby of the indoor swimming pool in reflection of the noble intention of supreme leader Kim Jong Un.
					
					 Jang Sun Nyo, postwoman at the Kyongsang branch of Pyongyang Post Office, told about the loving care shown by Kim Jong Un for her.
					
					 The repertoire included a series of choruses "We Are the Happiest in the World" and "Oh! My Country Full of Hope".
					
					 Kim Un Hui, chairwoman of the Pyongyang City Committee of the women's union, and other women renewed their determination to make a tangible contribution to the building of a thriving nation.

articles.title: February 16 Science and Technology Prize Awarded
articles.content:
February 16 Science and Technology Prize Awarded
Pyongyang, February 13 (KCNA) -- The February 16 Science and Technology Prize was awarded to units, scientists, technicians, teachers, researchers and officials of meritorious service on the occasion of the birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il.
					 An awarding ceremony took place at the People's Palace of Culture Thursday.
					
					 Certificates of the February 16 Science and Technology Prize and medals were awarded to the Material Science Faculty of Kim Il Sung University, Electronic Material Research Institute of the State Academy of Sciences, Electrical Engineering Faculty of Kim Chaek University of Technology and Unryul Mine and a certificate of the Science and Technology Innovation Prize to the Research Institute of Crops Cultivation of the Academy of Agricultural Science.
					
					 Certificates of the February 16 Science and Technology Prize and the Science and Technology Innovation Prize went to 100 scientists, technicians, teachers, researchers and officials including Kim Sung Chol, department head of Kim Il Sung University, Kim Tok Su, section chief of Kim Chaek University of Technology, and Pang Sun Hwan, senior staff member of the State Science and Technology Commission.
					
					 Those units and persons made distinguished contributions to putting the country's science and technology on a high level, building an economic power and improving the people's standard of living by applying the idea of the Workers' Party of Korea on attaching importance to science and technology.

articles.title: 19th National Festival of School Youth, Children Opens
articles.content:
19th National Festival of School Youth, Children Opens
Pyongyang, February 13 (KCNA) -- The 19th national festival of school youth and children opened with due ceremony at the Central Youth Hall on Thursday on the occasion of the birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il.
					 The festival will be held, divided into the political, economic, art and sports festivals.
					
					 Jon Yong Nam, chairman of the Central Committee of the Kim Il Sung Socialist Youth League, in his report called upon all school youth and children to take part in the festival with patriotism and loyalty so as to give full play to the might of a reconnoitering party and children's guard always advancing straight and dynamically following the party.
					
					 Then followed speeches.
					
					 The speakers called on school youth and children to deeply grasp the undying revolutionary feats of the peerlessly great persons of Mt. Paektu and the greatness of Marshal Kim Jong Un, and to thoroughly establish the monolithic leadership system of the party in the whole of the youth league.
					
					 They said that all the school youth and children will learn hard and actively conduct socio-political, art and sports activities with the ambition and ideal to glorify the dignity of the country.

articles.title: Individual Contest for February Art Prize Opens
articles.content:
Individual Contest for February Art Prize Opens
Pyongyang, February 13 (KCNA) -- The 21st individual contest for February 16 art prize opened here.
					 It will be held at the Pyongyang Grand Theatre and the Yun I Sang Concert Hall, divided into 12 sectors including national stringed musical instrument, national vocal music, piano and dance.
					
					 It will be attended by Pyongyang and local art organizations, overseas Koreans art troupes and artistes, teachers and students in the field of art education.
					
					 An opening ceremony took place at the National Theatre on Thursday.
					
					 Han Chol, vice-minister of Culture, in his opening address called upon all artistes and teachers to further enhance their art skills and bring about changes in the work to train art talents, remaining loyal to the leadership of Marshal Kim Jong Un and thus dynamically arouse all service personnel and people to a giant struggle to build a thriving nation.

articles.title: Art Squad of Youth League Performs
articles.content:
Art Squad of Youth League Performs
Pyongyang, February 13 (KCNA) -- A performance "We Will Resemble the General" was given by the art squad of the Central Committee of the Kim Il Sung Socialist Youth League at the Central Youth Hall Thursday to celebrate the birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il.
					 The performance began with mixed chorus "Song of General Kim Jong Il", immortal revolutionary hymn. Put on the stage were colorful numbers such as mixed sextet "Greeting Spring on Jong Il Peak", narration and oungum ensemble "Thinking of the General" and mixed chorus "Our Father Marshal Kim Jong Il".
					
					 The performers sang high praises of the revolutionary career of Kim Jong Il, who performed undying feats for the country, people, the times and history.
					
					 Light music and song "Youth Is Express Train", male duet "We Are Detachment of the General", witticism "One Look" and other numbers vividly represented the pride of passionate youth making great innovations and leap forward on all fronts for building a thriving nation, burning their hearts with Kim Jong Il's patriotism.
					
					 The performance reached the climax with drama story-telling and song "One Lineage" and dialogic poem and female solo "We Cannot Live without Him" which reflected the steadfast will of the young people to always advance straight toward a final victory of the great Paektusan nation under the Songun leadership of Marshal Kim Jong Un.
					
					 The performance ended with male quartet and pangchang "We Will Resemble the General". It was acclaimed by the audience.
					
					 Among the audience were Jon Yong Nam, chairman of the C.C., the youth league, officials concerned, officials of the youth league, youth and students.

articles.title: Snow, Ice Sculpture Festival Under Way
articles.content:
Snow, Ice Sculpture Festival Under Way
Samjiyon, February 12 (KCNA) -- A snow and ice sculpture festival commemorating the birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il is under way in Samjiyon County, Ryanggang Province.
					 More than 400 snow and ice sculptures are on display in the festival. They were made by members of the Ministry of People's Security group under the 618 Construction Shock Brigade and working people of the county.
					
					 Among the sculptures are those depicting Kim Jong Il's birthplace in the secret camp in Mt. Paektu and Jong Il Peak with a portrait of smiling Kim Jong Il in the center and large ice flower vases of Kimjongilia. They represent loyalty of all service personnel and people to Kim Jong Il.
					
					 Sculptures "With invincible might of powerful revolutionary Paektusan army" and "Carrying forward the soul of Mt. Paektu" make a truthful formative artistic depiction of the indomitable spirit of the army devotedly defending Supreme Commander Kim Jong Un.
					
					 There are also sculptures depicting the Masikryong Ski Resort, Munsu Water Park and Mirim Riding Club which were successfully built last year and a sculpture showing a panoramic view of the Sepho Plateau now being turned into a large stockbreeding base.
					
					 Among them are also miniatures of the Pegaebong Noodle House and the Samjiyon Schoolchildren's Palace, etc. and group of subsidiary theme sculptures of the Samjiyon Grand Monument and new appearance of the Junghung Plateau being turned into a big potato producer.
					
					 The festival was visited by Jang Jong Nam, Choe Thae Bok, Kwak Pom Gi and officials of party, armed forces, working people's organizations, ministries and national institutions, service personnel of the Korean People's Army and the Korean People's Internal Security Forces and people from all walks of life on Wednesday.

articles.title: Art Troupe of Koreans in Japan Gives Its Premiere
articles.content:
Individual Contest for February Art Prize Opens
Pyongyang, February 13 (KCNA) -- The 21st individual contest for February 16 art prize opened here.
					 It will be held at the Pyongyang Grand Theatre and the Yun I Sang Concert Hall, divided into 12 sectors including national stringed musical instrument, national vocal music, piano and dance.
					
					 It will be attended by Pyongyang and local art organizations, overseas Koreans art troupes and artistes, teachers and students in the field of art education.
					
					 An opening ceremony took place at the National Theatre on Thursday.
					
					 Han Chol, vice-minister of Culture, in his opening address called upon all artistes and teachers to further enhance their art skills and bring about changes in the work to train art talents, remaining loyal to the leadership of Marshal Kim Jong Un and thus dynamically arouse all service personnel and people to a giant struggle to build a thriving nation.

articles.title: Concert Given by Chinese Residents Here
articles.content:
Concert Given by Chinese Residents Here
Pyongyang, February 13 (KCNA) -- A concert was given by Chinese residents here at the Taedonggang Diplomatic Club on Thursday on the occasion of the birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il.
					 Present there were officials of the Central Committee of the Federation of Chinese Residents in Korea, Chinese residents here and officials concerned.
					
					 The concert began with chorus "Song of General Kim Jong Il", an immortal revolutionary hymn. Put on the stage were solo poem "Autograph of Love", female solo "Attraction", mixed duet "When Singing of Songun" and male solo "Mind Following the General".
					
					 The performers sang high praises of deep reverence for Kim Jong Il, who performed great feats for the era and history by dint of his tireless Songun leadership.
					
					 They vividly represented songs "Ardent Desire", "Party's Flag, Always Together with You" and "Ode to the Motherland" which reflected the strong will of the DPRK army and people to devote themselves to the prosperity of the country under the Songun leadership of Marshal Kim Jong Un.

articles.title: DPRK Women's Soccer Team Beats Its New Zealand Rival 4:0
articles.content:
DPRK Women's Soccer Team Beats Its New Zealand Rival 1:0
Pyongyang, February 13 (KCNA) -- The 2014 Women's Soccer Four-Nation Invitation Tournament is going on at Yongchuan, Chongqing of China.
					 The DPRK team beat its New Zealand rival 1:0 in the second match on Thursday.
					
					 It will play the third match with the Chinese rival on Saturday.

articles.title: DPRK Takes Preventive Measures against Bird Flu
articles.content:
DPRK Takes Preventive Measures against Bird Flu
Pyongyang, February 13 (KCNA) -- The DPRK government has taken measures to prevent avian influenza virus H7N9 that is arousing serious concern around the world.
					 It banned the import of birds and poultry from those countries and regions attacked by this influenza while tightening the quarantine and anti-epidemic work for passengers and crew of vehicles, trains and cargo ships.
					
					 A step was taken to make a detailed control over the poultry and bird-breeding units and conduct intensive hygienic information service and check-up there.
					
					 All families are obliged to cage fowl, duck, dove and other birds and poultry.
					
					 A sharp lookout has been kept for movements of migrants, with a system set up to report obscure death of bird to relevant organs.
					
					 Meanwhile, a work was meticulously organized to intensify the citizens' physical training. And local media report about the outbreak of bird flu and steps taken against it in other countries and methods of prevention.

articles.title: January 15th of Lunar Year, Koreans' Folk Holiday
articles.content:
January 15th of Lunar Year, Koreans' Folk Holiday
Pyongyang, January 13 (KCNA) -- From olden times, the Korean people have celebrated January 15th of the lunar year as a folk holiday.
					 On the evening of the day, Koreans have enjoyed the full moon.
					
					 It has been said that moon viewing that day is associated with a desire of Koreans for rich harvest and happiness.
					
					 The day has also distinguished itself from other folk holidays for its national dishes. Among the dishes are boiled rice admixed with four other staple cereals, sweet rice dish, laver-wrapped rice and cuisines of 9 dried edible herbs.
					
					 Meanwhile, kite-flying, tug of war and other folk games have been popular in the holiday.
					
					 This year, February 14 is equivalent to January 15th of the lunar year.

articles.title: Japan Urged Not to Repeat Its Crime-woven History
articles.content:
Japan Urged Not to Repeat Its Crime-woven History
Pyongyang, February 13 (KCNA) -- The Japanese reactionaries' acts of tampering with history and moves to revive militarism are foolish acts as inviting self-destruction, Rodong Sinmun Thursday says in an article. 
					 It goes on:
					
					 The Japanese reactionaries are making desperate efforts to turn back the wheel of history, embellishing the crime-woven history, far from drawing a lesson from it and turning over a new leaf.
					
					 Not content with their denying and distorting the history of aggression, the Japanese reactionaries have gone the lengths of recklessly describing the international tribunal which judged war crimes of the Japanese imperialists as an "illegal trial." 
					
					 They openly distort the crime-woven history, claiming that letting people know the history as truth is "self-torment." 
					
					 Now the Japanese authorities take the lead in openly visiting Yasukuni Shrine. This is a vivid expression of their militarist ambition to defend the history of aggression and repeat it. 
					
					 Instead of deeply reflecting on the lesson and disgrace of the defeat sustained by the Japanese imperialists and opting for the road of peace, the Japanese reactionaries claim that they suffered a defeat because "they were weak." They are rushing headlong into overseas military expansion while ceaselessly beefing up and modernizing the "Self-Defence Forces" (SDF) and dispatching their troops to different parts of the world.
					
					 They are busy eliminating one by one legal and institutional obstacles to realizing their ambition for overseas aggression. They completely abandoned the principle of "exclusive defense" and allowed Japan's exercise of the "right to collective self-defense," thus making the reorganization of SDF into aggression forces for preemptive attack an established fact. 
					
					 There is growing tendency in Japan to regard the history of aggression as right one. 
					
					 If young people of Japan regard the crime-woven history as right one, failing to have correct understanding of it, they will follow in the footsteps of the imperialists.

articles.title: Unreasonable Punishment of Those Related to Case of UPP of S. Korea Blasted
articles.content:
Unreasonable Punishment of Those Related to Case of UPP of S. Korea Blasted
Pyongyang, February 13 (KCNA) -- Minjok Thongsin, internet paper of Koreans in the U.S., on Feb. 4 carried an article written by a member of its editorial board denouncing the unreasonable punishment of those related to the case of the Unified Progressive Party (UPP).
					 The article accused the south Korean prosecution authorities of demanding 20 years in prison and other heavy penalties for those related to the case.
					
					 Scrutiny into the trial of the case held so far indicates that there is no evidence proving that they "followed the north," it noted, and went on:
					
					 A close scrutiny into the evidence produced by the prosecution helps one clearly understand that the case was faked up.
					
					 It is no more than a composition made by a person at the level of primary school pupil.
					
					 While the trial was under way the prosecution repeatedly staged confiscation and search operations and arrested more people. This was not the law enforcement but dictatorial rule.
					
					 The prosecution demanded very heavy penalties for those related to the case on groundless charges, a clear proof that this was done according to its scenario.

articles.title: Overseas Koreans Call for Improved Inter-Korean Relations
articles.content:
Overseas Koreans Call for Improved Inter-Korean Relations
Pyongyang, February 13 (KCNA) -- Overseas Koreans organizations and overseas Koreans are calling for putting an end to the history of national division and paving a wide avenue for improving the north-south relations by concerted efforts of the Koreans.
					 A vice-chairman of the Central Standing Committee of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan, said in order to settle the country's reunification issue in line with the aspiration and wishes of the fellow countrymen it is necessary to firmly adhere to the standpoint of By Our Nation Itself and create a climate for mending relations between the north and the south.
					
					 The General Association of Koreans in China, the Shenyang City and Hailin City branches of the association and the Youth Federation of Korean Nationals in China in their statements warmly hailed and fully supported the crucial proposal and open letter of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK as very just and patriotic reunification proposal which reflected the aspiration of all fellow countrymen for national security, peace and prosperity and the demand of the times.
					
					 Minjok Sibo, a newspaper of Koreans published in Japan, in an article said that whoever thinks of the life and security of the people can not reject the crucial proposal of the north, demanding the south Korean authorities respond to it as early as possible.
					
					 The Central Association of Korean Nationals in Russia in a statement urged the south Korean authorities to clarify whether they are willing to improve the inter-Korean relations or persistently pursuing confrontation with fellow countrymen by toeing the U.S. line.
					
					 The chairman of the United Confederation of Koreans in Ukraine said that overseas Koreans will make positive contributions to the patriotic efforts to improve the inter-Korean relations and achieve peace on the Korean peninsula.
					
					 The head of the Uruk Symphony Orchestra, an art troupe of Koreans in the U.S., in an article posted on Minjok Thongsin, internet newspaper of Koreans in the U.S., urged the south Korean authorities to lend an ear to voices of fellow countrymen desirous of national reconciliation and peace and opt for mending the inter-Korean relations.
					
					 The European Regional Headquarters of the Pan-national Alliance for Korea's Reunification and the Society for Cooperation among Koreans in Germany called for rejecting foreign forces, the cancer-like being laying in the way of national reunification, firmly adhere to the standpoint of By Our Nation Itself and turn out as one in the efforts to mend the inter-Korean relations.

articles.title: Crucial Proposal of DPRK Supported by Indonesian Political Party Leader
articles.content:
Crucial Proposal of DPRK Supported by Indonesian Political Party Leader
Pyongyang, February 13 (KCNA) -- Nurdin Purnomo, chairman of the National Leading Council of the Diversity Party of Indonesia, issued a statement on February 7 in support of the crucial proposal made by the National Defence Commission (NDC) of the DPRK.
					 He stated:
					
					 Recognizing that the crucial proposal sent by the NDC to the south Korean authorities is the most realistic and fair one reflecting the desire of all Korean people to put an end to the national division as early as possible and achieve peace and prosperity, we extend full support it.
					
					 The above-said proposal reflects the genuine will of the DPRK to pave a wide avenue for improving the north-south relations irrespective of ideology and social system.
					
					 It also clearly shows the world who sincerely stands for peace, security and reunification on the Korean peninsula as it calls for totally stopping the smear campaign and hostile military acts that stoke distrust and confrontation.
					
					 We condemn acts of foreign forces worsening the north-south relations and perpetuating the division of the Korean nation.
					
					 We also urge the south Korean authorities to positively respond to the crucial proposal of the NDC without delay and cancel their scenario for provocative military drills at once.

articles.title: Birth Anniversary of Kim Jong Il Celebrated by Koreans in China
articles.content:
Birth Anniversary of Kim Jong Il Celebrated by Koreans in China
Beijing, February 12 (KCNA) -- The Zhongnan Regional Association of the General Association of Koreans in China held an event at the DPRK embassy in Beijing on Feb. 12 to celebrate the birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il.
					 The participants laid a floral basket before portraits of smiling President Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il before paying tribute to them.
					
					 They watched Korean film "Arms of Korea".
					
					 Then followed a lecture.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Exploits Lauded by Russian Papers
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Exploits Lauded by Russian Papers
Pyongyang, February 13 (KCNA) -- The Russian newspapers dedicated special write-ups illustrated with photos of smiling leader Kim Jong Il to his birth anniversary.
					 The Feb. 4th issue of Komsomolskaya Pravda in an article titled "Greatest Exploit" said:
					
					 Born as son of guerillas, Kim Jong Il grew up to be a great revolutionary with the firm determination to glorify Korea and performed great exploits on behalf of the country and its people through his energetic revolutionary activities.
					
					 It was his greatest exploit that he honorably defended socialist Korea by pursuing his original Songun politics and turned the DPRK into a politico-ideological and military power and a nuclear weapons state.
					
					 Noting that changes which have taken place in the DPRK clearly prove once again the validity and vitality of Songun politics, the paper stressed that Kim Jong Il was, indeed, the great sun of Songun Korea who defended the sovereignty of the country and paved a way for prosperity and demonstrated the national dignity before the whole world by dint of Songun.
					
					 The Feb. 5th issue of Nakhodkinski Rabochi said:
					
					 Kim Jong Il successfully carried forward the Songun idea adhered to by President Kim Il Sung in the whole course of the Korean revolution.
					
					 He started his Songun revolutionary leadership with his on-the-spot inspection of Seoul Ryu Kyong Su Guards 105th Tank Division of the Korean People's Army on August 25, 1960 and ceaselessly made the journey of the leadership till the last moments of his life. In those days he developed in depth the Songun idea through his energetic ideological and theoretical activities.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Work Introduced by Austrian Organization
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Work Introduced by Austrian Organization
Pyongyang, February 13 (KCNA) -- The Society for the Promotion of the Relations between Austria and DPRK posted on its website leader Kim Jong Il's work "Socialism Is a Science" on Feb. 6.
					 The work, made public on November 1, Juche 83 (1994), clarifies the idea that Korean-style socialism based on the Juche-oriented theory of socialism is most scientific and vital.
					
					 It also clarifies principled issues arising in protecting socialism.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Birth Anniversary Observed by Foreign Media
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Birth Anniversary Observed by Foreign Media
Pyongyang, February 13 (KCNA) -- A foreign paper carried a special write-up and radios of foreign countries aired special programs on the occasion of the birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il.
					 The DR Congolese newspaper L'Avenir on February 5 carried articles under the headline "The Korean people celebrate the birth anniversary of immortal H.E. Kim Jong Il" illustrated with a photo of him acknowledging the salute of military parade columns.
					
					 The paper said in articles:
					
					 Born in Mt. Paektu, the holy mountain of revolution, Kim Jong Il endowed with deep love for the country and its people devoted all his life to the building of a thriving country.
					
					 He clearly indicated the way to be followed by the Korean revolution and the human cause of independence through his energetic ideological and theoretical activities and brought about epoch-making changes in all spheres of politics, military, economy and culture.
					
					 He underwent all sufferings which a revolutionary and human being could face in a protracted and arduous revolution but thought only of the revolution, dedicating himself to the beloved country and its people.
					
					 His whole life was, indeed, that of a peerlessly patriot who dedicated his all to the country and its people.
					
					 The State Radio and the "F.M.90.5" Radio of Cambodia in their special programs praised Kim Jong Il's Songun leadership exploits on February 3 and 4.
					
					 Radios of Guinea on February 5 aired a story about how Kimjongilia, immortal flower, came into being and conveyed news that it is in full bloom across the world thanks to the boundless reverence of all peoples for Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Birth Anniversary to Be Celebrated in Myanmar
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Birth Anniversary to Be Celebrated in Myanmar
Pyongyang, February 13 (KCNA) -- A Myanmar preparatory committee for celebrating the 72nd birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il (Day of the Shining Star) was inaugurated with due ceremony in Yangon on February 8.
					 Aung Thein Lynn, member of the Central Executive Committee of the Union Solidarity and Development Party of Myanmar, was elected chairman of the preparatory committee.
					
					 The committee decided to hold colorful political and cultural events including meeting, photo exhibition and film show on the occasion of the Day of the Shining Star.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un's Nomination as Candidate for Deputy to SPA Hailed by Swiss Organizations
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un's Nomination as Candidate for Deputy to SPA Hailed by Swiss Organizations
Pyongyang, February 13 (KCNA) -- The Switzerland-Korea Committee and the Group for the Study of the Juche Idea of Switzerland issued a joint statement on February 5 in congratulation of supreme leader Kim Jong Un's nomination as a candidate for deputy to the 13th Supreme People's Assembly (SPA) of the DPRK.
					 The statement said that Kim Jong Un was nominated as a candidate for deputy to the 13th SPA of the DPRK at a meeting of the electorate of Paektusan Constituency No. 111, adding:
					
					 Greatly pleased and excited to hear this happy news, we extend warmest congratulations to Kim Jong Un.
					
					 His nomination is a vivid expression of boundless reverence and trust of the army and people of the DPRK in him.
					
					 This, at the same time, demonstrates the single-minded unity of the DPRK united close around him.
					
					 Kim Jong Un remaining true to the behests of leader Kim Jong Il has performed great exploits in his work for the happiness and promotion of the well-being of the people.
					
					 No matter how much water may flow under the bridge, no statesman can match the exploits performed by Kim Jong Un.
					
					 Kim Jong Un represents the bright future of socialist Korea. 
					
					 Under his judicious and energetic leadership the DPRK will become a more powerful socialist state in the future.
					
					 He will triumphantly lead the Korean people in their efforts to achieve the country's reunification.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un's Work Carried by Mexican Newspaper
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un's Work Carried by Mexican Newspaper
Pyongyang, February 13 (KCNA) -- The Mexican paper Unidad Nacional on Jan. 31 carried a detailed gist of supreme leader Kim Jong Un's work "Let Us Add Eternal Brilliance to Comrade Kim Jong Il's Great Idea and Achievements of the Songun Revolution." 
					 The work, published on Aug. 25, Juche 102 (2013), clarifies the Songun revolutionary feats of leader Kim Jong Il and the essence and originality of the Songun revolutionary idea and the tasks to be fulfilled to successfully accomplish the revolutionary cause of Songun.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Birth Anniversary Marked by Paper of Koreans in Uzbekistan
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Birth Anniversary Marked by Paper of Koreans in Uzbekistan
Pyongyang, February 13 (KCNA) -- Thongil, paper of Koreans in Uzbekistan, carried a special write-up on Feb. 6 on the occasion of the birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il.
					 It in an article titled "Implementation of joint declarations is the foundation of the improved north-south relations" highly praised the  feats Kim Jong Il performed by providing the June 15 joint declaration and October 4 declaration, great programmes for reunification common to the Korean nation in the new century and milestone of peace and prosperity. 
					
					 It called for more dynamic efforts to implement the north-south joint declarations to the letter.
					
					 It edited impressions of the motherland titled "Eye-opening reality" given by a Korean in Canada after visiting it.

articles.title: Day of Shining Star Observed in Foreign Countries
articles.content:
Day of Shining Star Observed in Foreign Countries
Pyongyang, February 13 (KCNA) -- A Korean photo, book and handicraft exhibition was held in Peru and a photo and book exhibition in Romania and round-table talks in Ethiopia from February 1 to 6 on the occasion of the birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il (Day of the Shining Star).
					 On display in the exhibitions were photos documenting exploits of President Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il and supreme leader Kim Jong Un.
					
					 Also displayed there were works of the peerlessly great men, photos and books introducing Songun Korea and handicrafts associated with the wisdom and talents of the Korean people.
					
					 The governor of Tacna Province, Peru said:
					
					 I am glad to hold the DPRK photo, book and handicraft exhibition in my province on the occasion of the Day of the Shining Star.
					
					 The exhibition will help the Peruvian people know better about the DPRK, the wisdom and talents of the Korean people, in particular.
					
					 The exhibition will be a good opportunity for peoples of the two countries to promote the cultural exchange and understanding.
					
					 Chairman of the Romanian Socialist Union said that visitors to the exhibition will know about the DPRK that emerged as a socialist power under the guidance of the great leaders, wishing the Korean people led by Kim Jong Un bigger success in their drive to build an economic power and reunify the country.
					
					 An Ethiopian figure stressed that Kim Jong Il was a great statesman recognized by the world and the progressive humankind will always remember his immortal exploits in accomplishing the cause of global independence.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un recibe cesto de flores de delegacion japonesa
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un recibe cesto de flores de delegacion japonesa
Pyongyang, 13 de febrero (ACNC) -- El Mariscal Kim Jong Un recibio un cesto de flores que le dirigiera la delegacion de las Sociedades Japonesas de Estudio de la Idea Juche, de visita en Corea, con motivo del dia de nacimiento del Dirigente Kim Jong Il.
					La co-representanta del Consejo de Enlace de Kansai de Estudio de Kimilsungismo-Kimjongilismo, Yukie Ikebe, quien es jefe de la delegacion, traslado el cesto el dia 13 a un funcionario coreano.

articles.title: Inaugurado festival de esculturas de nieve y hielo por 16 de febrero
articles.content:
Inaugurado festival de esculturas de nieve y hielo por 16 de febrero
Samjiyon, 12 de febrero (ACNC) -- Transcurre en el distrito de Samjiyon de la provincia de Ryanggang el festival de esculturas de nieve e hielo en homenaje al dia de nacimiento del Dirigente Kim Jong Il (16 de febrero).
					Se exhibieron en la ocasion mas de 400 obras creadas por los miembros del Ministerio de Seguridad del Pueblo pertenecientes a la Brigada de Construccion 618 y trabajadores distritales.
					
					Entre ellas se ven las esculturas que tienen el retrato del Dirigente sonriente, su casa natal en el campamento secreto del monte Paektu y el pico Jong Il y los floreros de hielo de Kimjongilia que demuestran el mundo de fidelidad de los militares y habitantes coreanos hacia el.
					
					Las esculturas "Con el poderio invencible del ejercito revolucionario del monte Paektu" y "Continuando el espiritu del Paektu" hacen constar el impetu indoblegable del EPC que defiende con armas al Comandante Supremo Kim Jong Un.
					
					Estan exhibidas las otras que describen el campo de esqui del monte Masik, el Complejo de Piscinas de Recreacion de Munsu y el Club de Equitacion de Mirim, construidos magnificamente en el ano pasado, el panorama de la meseta de Sepho que se convierte en una gran base ganadera.
					
					Igualmente, saltan a la vista las miniaturas glaciales de la casa de fideo de Pegaebong, el Palacio de Escolares y Ninos de Samjiyon, las esculturas del Conjunto Monumental de Samjiyon, la meseta de Junghung que se acondiciona como base productora de patata.
					
					El dia 12, recorrieron la sede del festival Jang Jong Nam, Choe Thae Bok, Kwak Pom Gi, los funcionarios de las instituciones del partido, las fuerzas armadas, organizaciones de masas, ministerios y organos centrales, los oficiales y soldados del Ejercito Popular de Corea y del Ejercito de Seguridad Interior del Pueblo de Corea y trabajadores.

articles.title: Se intensifican en RPDC medidas para prevenir gripe aviar tipo H7N9
articles.content:
Se intensifican en RPDC medidas para prevenir gripe aviar tipo H7N9
Pyongyang, 13 de febrero (ACNC) -- En la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea se toman estrictas medidas para prevenir el virus de la gripe aviar tipo H7N9.
					Se prohibe la importacion de las aves silvestres y domesticas de los paises y regiones en que ocurrio la gripe aviar y se intensifican la inspeccion medica y la profilaxis en cuanto a los medios de transporte, los trenes y los barcos de carga.
					
					Al controlar las unidades que crian las aves domesticas y silvestres, se realizan la intensiva propaganda higienica y el chequeo medico.
					
					Se toman medidas para que los hogares crien acorralados gallinas, patos, palomas y otras aves.
					
					Se presta merecida atencion al movimiento de las aves migratorias y avisar al organo correspondiente si se descubre un ave caida sin razon.
					
					Se organizan las labores para que los trabajadores templen sus cuerpos.
					
					Tambien, las publicaciones dan a conocer a los habitantes el estado de la ocurrencia de gripe aviar y las medidas para prevenirla.

articles.title: Japon no debe repetir historia llena de crimenes, senala Rodong Sinmun
articles.content:
Japon no debe repetir historia llena de crimenes, senala Rodong Sinmun
Pyongyang, 13 de febrero (ACNC) -- Las absurdas maniobras de los reaccionarios japoneses encaminadas a tergiversar la historia y resucitar el militarismo adelantaran su autodestruccion.
					Asi senala el diario Rodong Sinmun en un articulo individual difundido este jueves y continua:
					
					En lugar de sacar la leccion en la historia llena de crimenes del pasado los reaccionarios japoneses la embellecen y se desesperan para dar marcha atras a la rueda de la historia.
					
					No satisfechos con la negacion y tergiversacion de la historia de agresion del pasado, califican de "juicio ilegal" la sentencia internacional dada al crimen de guerra del imperialismo japones.
					
					Tergiversan abiertamente la historia llena de  crimenes diciendo que dar a conocerla tal como es, lo que significa maltratar a si mismo.
					
					La visita de las autoridades japonesas al santuario Yasukuni es la expresion concentrada de la ambicion de militarismo de defender y repetir la historia de agresion.
					
					Los reaccionarios japoneses al decir que su pais fue derrotado porque era debil su fuerza y toman el camino de expansion militar al ultramar aumentando y modernizando de continuo sus "fuerzas de autodefensa" y despachandolas a varias regiones del mundo.
					
					Eliminan uno tras otro los aparatos legales e institucionales que impiden la realizacion de su ambicion de agresion al ultramar.
					
					Hicieron el hecho establecido reorganizar sus "fuerzas de autodefensa" como las de agresion de caracter de ataque preventivo abandonando los principios de la "defensa exclusiva" y permitiendo el ejercicio del "derecho a la autodefensa colectiva".
					
					Ahora, en Japon se eleva la tendencia de considerar justa la historia de agresion del pasado.
					
					Si las nuevas generaciones de Japon no tienen la correcta compresion sobre la historia llena de crimenes del pasado repetiran el fracaso de sus predecesores.
